website_summaries.verdict: Engineered to fit into a one-liter bottle and expand into a life raft that's durable and appreciated by those who like to explore.
pros: Customers appreciate the price point given the raft's versatility
Functions well for calm water as well as crossing rivers and maneuvering over waves
cons: While adaptable in many environments, not intended for rapids

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for mild rivers.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to cross a river in Alaska. I did not fill the seat with air, which allowed helped keep my center of gravity a little lower. Very pack-able, but would not recommend for heavy rapids.
customer_reviews.author: Demo_Dude

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome. It inflates much more easily than expected with ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome. It inflates much more easily than expected with the included bag. I imagined laboring awkwardly to get it blown up, but I figured that would be the necessary trade off for such a small solution. As it turns out, inflation is really easy, and takes just a minute or two! I'm very impressed with everything about this unit, especially for the price. Together with the Onyx M-16 PFD and an ultralight 4 piece paddle, the entire setup fits in a little day backpack. Perfect for my short morning outings to the local county lake and state park creek.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Antonaccio

customer_reviews.title: Why did I buy this?
customer_reviews.text: well, guess you get what you pay for. a cheap, hard to paddle dinghy that barely floats. I am a quite strong and sturdy person used to my hardshell sit on top fishing kayak and got this to try out backcountry lake adventures. Not worth it at all. Can't fish from it and wouldn't trust it with packrafting. Will be selling on ebay or returning.
customer_reviews.author: filmforever

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY THIS! Shame on Amazon for making this an Amazon choice product! I need zero star as a rating. It is obvious that a batch of these were produced with no quality control-as it has a major kink in one side upon inflation (noted by other reviewers) and they should have been recalled instead of foisted upon customers. I can't believe any pro contributed to this design. it doesn't track at all. It is not supportive nor is it ergonomically comfortable. the only good that came from this purchase was Amazon taking care of customer service afterward. it's not worth $10 !
customer_reviews.author: extremely disappointed purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Good simple boat
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from hauling this boat around high lakes of the Sierras. We punctured it once, pulling it out of the water over rough granite. I could not locate my inflation bag, So with a runner band and a 3 gallon plastic bag, We inflated it albeit too slow, especially if there was no wind to puff the bag open. I had a lot of fun with the boat. It is definitely worth its weight to pack along on lake trips and class one waters. Bring some seam seal repair for small leaks.. Don't lose your inflation bag...
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Most Portable Raft, Excellent Design
customer_reviews.text: This is arguable the most portable raft there is. It packs down as described. It does not have a skeg or rudder. So you will drift everywhere. If you use this as a raft, you will NOT be disappointed. This is best used in calm waters or drifting gently down stream. Dress to get wet, as water easily gets in. I was lucky to buy this for $100/ea. It took 20 cycles with the included dry/bag to inflate the raft. It easily deflates on its own, if left be. Also makes a great mattress when ashore (be certain there are no pointy bits underneath).
customer_reviews.author: paititi

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome. Stows away so small
customer_reviews.text: Took this up to Cave Lake in Northern Nevada. It's awesome. Stows away so small, yet absolutely fits a (ONE) person just fine. Also added a collapsible kayak paddle and was able to move around just fine. Quick recommendation, after you fill it with air, once it hits the water, add more air as the exposure to cold water will cause the air inside to contract heavily.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, I got a dud?
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it will work well but when we inflated it after backpacking it in, ours seems deformed like the fabric was not cut correctly or it was not glued right? It is fully inflated in the picture but deformed on the left side which made it very hard to get into. Going to return for a new one and hopefully it will be fine. I looked at the picture and videos online and ours looks different when fully inflated. Will update when the new one gets here.
customer_reviews.author: Tod L.

customer_reviews.title: A backpack must have
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. I found it for 99.00 on promotive after I bought it but oh well. I tested it out with great success around a lake. I tell everyone about it because I think everyone should have this in their pack. There are lighter rafts but for the money this can't be beat. Raft with the lightweight ores I got weigh 3 1/2 pounds. It folds up to about the size of a Gatorade bottle. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jason mcgimpsey

customer_reviews.title: Using hand paddles it works way better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Took a long time to inflate at home. With the breeze by the lake it was a different story it totally filled up the stuff sack for inflation. Difficult to put the cap back on the air valve. You’re going to get a little wet because when it hits the Coldwater it deflates some. Wasn’t expecting much because the lake was pretty breezy and I just had these two kids spades I picked up to use as hand paddles. Then wow! Using the hand paddles at the same time prevented it from wagging back-and-forth and it cut through the water both ways and even into the breeze with remarkable ease. Would buy it again in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not very sea worthy
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped to take this boat on backpacks, as I have done many times with the old Sevylor Trail Boat. (Which has been discontinued). Unfortunately this new boat is harder to stay dry in. (Important for the fully clothed cold water trips). The one I got also has a slow leak right out of the box. If my last Trail Boat dies I may have to use this thing, but it is just not as easy to use or as comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell I hope they hold up
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be well made but very difficult to inflate it need some type adapters inflate. The bag they sent as a pump come from sin and awkward. I made my own adapters by cutting off the end of the inflatable bag and epoxy it to an air pump.
customer_reviews.author: Edward B

customer_reviews.title: Lost air quickly
customer_reviews.text: I really like what Klymit is trying to do for the packrafting activity. For that I give them 5 stars. However, product lost significant air indoors at constant temperature in 1.5h. )pictures attached) Experiment was repeated numerous times to make sure valves were closed, etc. I sent this back.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: great one man raft
customer_reviews.text: I like this raft because it was easy to use and very durable. I use the raft for floating with small groups down the river which is a narrow river with lots of spines and sticks pointing out on the edges of the river. I was very impressed with it durablity under this conditions. Also after floating the raft is very easy to desinflate in a matter of seconds after rafting we had the air out of the ratfs .
customer_reviews.author: Duston

customer_reviews.title: Puts a new shine on old trails.
customer_reviews.text: While nowhere near as durable or technically capable as a whitewater packraft (Alpacka) or an inflatable kayak (Advanced Elements), this litewater packraft is also nowhere near the weight (Approx 35oz), size (loaf of bread), or price ($135ish) as those higher end boats. Having this in your pack adds a new dimension to short lakeside hikes, riverside trails, and backpacking trips that follow deeper creek runs. Trails that I have hiked 100 times before are now seeming to deserve another visit. That's the biggest value of the LWD to me.
customer_reviews.author: John Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Not 35oz
customer_reviews.text: NOT the 35oz version. Felt super heavy so I weighed it. Sure enough it's 44oz. The weird thing is that the package says 35, so I think this is a used newer version in the old packaging....
customer_reviews.author: Blah

customer_reviews.title: Broken intake valve after four uses
customer_reviews.text: Intake valve broke after four uses. One-way air flow membrane completely detached from valve. Unable to inflate. Now useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sputnik

customer_reviews.title: Solid backpacking tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid backpackable dingy. It's not the best boat out there, but it more than makes up for that by being highly portable and easy to inflate with the provided tools. Just add a lightweight paddle and a dry sack for your backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice little raft
customer_reviews.text: I actually like this little guy a lot....it small and super light weight... not whitewater raft but definitely a huge upgrade from a tube
customer_reviews.author: mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great..
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great...the stuff sack works as a pump through the one way inflate valve....and its so light... Ok...it's not an alpaca but you could buy 8 or 9 of these for the cost of one of those... Survived a float down the North Fork of the Shenandoah River with 2-3 kids jumping in and out of it...if that's not a durability test I dont know what is!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander White

customer_reviews.title: Great small raft
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent basic raft. I would really appreciate the ability to quickly inflate it using a couple of CO2 inflators. I’d pay an additional 25-30% for that capability.
customer_reviews.author: Kestrel

customer_reviews.title: This is so great to throw in my bike bag and play in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so great to throw in my bike bag and play in the lakes of Seattle. I was able to paddle around with my 65 lb pit bull and bike bag with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Easterday

customer_reviews.title: Klymit packrafts don't hold air.
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 of the Klymit packrafts from Amazon and both failed to hold air. Something's wrong with the materials/design. I wrote to Klymit but haven't heard back yet.
customer_reviews.author: gray thompson

customer_reviews.title: light enough to backpack with for days
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and light. If that's the more important than maneuverability and size, this is a good choice. 5 day packpacking with canyoneering gear? Probably good to keep weight down. Have paddled it a couple days down small river with lots of class II rapids.
customer_reviews.author: Gsleeper

customer_reviews.title: Nice little boat
customer_reviews.text: Small and light exactly as described. I wish it was a little longer, because at 180 cm height, I don't have enough room for legs. The material looks and feels robust. It's easy to inflate (especially during windy weather, when the wind fills an inlation bag in no time) and very quick do deflate and pack. No more "I wish I had a boat here", just add another 1 kg to the luggage and go!
customer_reviews.author: Michal Mackiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect
customer_reviews.text: Paddling is a trick. The raft definitely struggles to go straight but for its size and weight it is really quiet remarkable. I've really enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford L. Rosson

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: Im from chile and i used the dinghy a lot tris Summer. But i did not carry my bike or mountain bag yet. The only detail is that depends of the temperature of the water how much air you will lose, is better play in the water with the boat and then inflate again because always will lose air the first time you entry in the water
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo M.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this raft for several months now. I use it to kayak off the beaches of SE Asia. It's well made (in Taiwan) and extremely portable. Not massively impressed with the inflatable seat so I don't use it. You are going to get wet. Pretty quick to inflate and deflate. But overall a really fun way to enjoy calm coastal waters.
customer_reviews.author: Redman

customer_reviews.title: defect4ive
customer_reviews.text: Leaked the 1st time used. Maybe just a defect, so two stars. I asked for a refund! Too bad because it was really light wgt. to backpack into high altitude lakes.
customer_reviews.author: rdw

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I'll update after I get back from backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: I took it out on a 5 mile paddle on ...
customer_reviews.text: I took it out on a 5 mile paddle on a flat water river. It was slow compared to my buddies hardshell kayak but it was much easier to get to the water. It worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Imbroglio

customer_reviews.title: These things are great! I bought 3 to use as emergency rafts
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! I bought 3 to use as emergency rafts. Sure, they'd take a bit to inflate if you need them, but for what I need them for, we'd have time. Very nice and light and packable.
customer_reviews.author: Timmayyy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, not great. Don't expect to stay dry at all, not very well desiged as water will seep in the fold by your butt. Use as a pool toy or on a warm lake.
customer_reviews.author: Anders Algotsson

customer_reviews.title: Trade secret for alpine lake fishing!
customer_reviews.text: Using this raft for fishing remote mountain lakes. It is easy to carry, fast to set up. The only drawback is it doesn't provide much back support. I am liking it!
customer_reviews.author: Brian J Renstrom

customer_reviews.title: You cannot expect it to behave like a "true" kayak
customer_reviews.text: It's really light and portable: you can put it in your backpack and forget it it takes almost no space and weights very little. and, once in the water, it works. You cannot expect it to behave like a "true" kayak, but it does its job quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Romaní

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: Shipped supper fast and the actual quality of the product is much better than I had expected. You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good for intended purposes
customer_reviews.text: Cool raft for short crossings & playing on backcountry lakes. By far not as fast or efficient as my kayak for long paddles. That's only reason for 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect pack raft
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pack raft. I have used it for casual floats on alpine lakes. I fit comfortably in the raft and feel stable while sitting up. I am 6' 1" 210lbs and it supports me no problem. The inflation bag takes a few tries getting used to but once you have it down, it works great. I recommend a light weight collapsible kayak paddle but you can get by using your hands if you're just floating around at the beach. Not sure how this would fair on a river. Anything more than a gentle flow and the raft may be difficult to control.
customer_reviews.author: BizzyB

customer_reviews.title: Weight, size!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Ultralight packraft, small package - best choice for solo trip. Fast inflate with airbag, very easy deflate. Very fast delivery to Russia (one week).
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Works well for what I use it for!
customer_reviews.text: I like to hike to alpine lakes (sometimes camp lakeside) and this raft is perfect for floating/paddling around with the whole lake to yourself, haven't used it in the river yet. The tracking isn't the greatest, but it's no different than an alpacka packraft which is ten times the price of this one. I tried out alpackas before buying this one so I know how both of them work and this one is not perfect, but great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Took this raft out on flat water in Vermont. ...
customer_reviews.text: Took this raft out on flat water in Vermont. Very stable, material is very durable. Extremely lightweight. Had it in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: pstarling

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and easy to inflate, it only took me 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gomez Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value - calm water raft suitable for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and the kids hiked with it up to some high mountain lakes. Pumps up fast, very stable, light enough for backpacking, and durable enough to have some fun on calm lakes. Also purchased a backpacking kayak paddle with it -- highly recommended accessory. Hours and hours of fun on a remote lake. They had a great time and would definitely do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Really like this raft
customer_reviews.text: Really like this raft. It's light weight and easy to pump up with the bag. It is not the easiest thing to steer though and works better with weight on the front like a pack.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Gilder

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Ultra-lightweight, small package size, easy to use. Very suitable for high mountain lake rafting, also good for rivers (no more than class 1 rapids).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, easy to blow up and held up well.
customer_reviews.text: Blows up quickly and is light. Be careful if there is a mountain breeze it does act like a sail and is hard to paddle against breeze using one paddle. Held up well and was pleasantly surprised at the ease of use. Used on a mountain lake to fish and paddle around.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Love my Klymit!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Klymit! I fastpack and trail run mostly on trails in the Alpine Lakes area in Washington state and the Klymit is a perfect addition to being able to enjoy fast packing and some time in the water as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a bugout kit
customer_reviews.text: Yes, in every way! Rugged, unbelievably light, still can't get over the fact that when you hike with this in your pack you're taking a boat with you!! Great for a bugout kit!!
customer_reviews.author: carlos del valle

customer_reviews.title: not so clear sailing
customer_reviews.text: I love this little boat. I look forward to using it. I wasn't clear on how to inflate it until I found a youtube video a couple days after I got it and inflated it in my living room w/ an battery operated pump. Be very picky in selecting a paddle for it. But it's everything & more. The company contacted me before charging my account to let me know it wasn't color the picture stated...I didn't care, it's a wonderful craft and I look forward to years of fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: but sturdy enough. If you are looking for a Sevylor ...
customer_reviews.text: More of a float than a raft. It is made of coated fabric, so it is very light, but sturdy enough. If you are looking for a Sevylor Trail boat, this is of similar material. It has a check valve on the inlet, that worked surprisingly well with an inflator that wasn't even close to fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Paul  S

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: I received the product on time. Good quality product, easy to fill, within my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Andre Gouveia de Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far.
customer_reviews.text: So far used on ponds/lakes and works well. Light and compact. I haven't used it enough to give an in depth review but so far I'm pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alex innis

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this as a flotation mattress
customer_reviews.text: This item did not hold air properly and it does not track in a straight line if you want to use it as a "paddle-able device". I found that I had to barely scratch the surface of the water to not go into a half circle & that made up upper arms really fatigued. I would have gotten sea sick the way it tracked & I don't get sea sick. I would recommend this as a flotation mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine St. John

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight raft for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale for $79 and was super happy. I went on an extremely long hike that required me to raft across a lake at the end so it was a must that I bring a lightweight raft with all my other gear. Inflated quick, held air perfectly & I didn't get heavily soaked like others claimed & I'm 205 pounds/6 foot tall. Wait to see it on sale before buying since full price is way to expensive.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC DUYETTE

product_meta.title: KLYMIT LITEWATER DINGHY (LWD) Packraft, Inflatable Travel Kayak, Packs Small for Backpacking
product_meta.description: The LiteWater Dinghy is a gamechanger. It is an advanced pack raft that will beckon adventurers toward new horizons. Designed with input from pro kayakers and packrafters, Klymit’s first entry into the paddle sports market has been made, and made with vigor. Featuring an advanced boat shape that tracks water and an ergonomic seating position that allows comfortable, upright, and well supported paddling position, the LWD paddles well and feels good on the water. Weighing in at 35 oz and packing down to 4 x 9 inches, you will forget you had it in your pack. Alpine lakes and rivers are now part of your backcountry playground, stay dry canyoneering, go camp on an untouched island with the LWD...why not?
feature_bullets: Designed with input from Pro kayakers and packrafters, the LWD is an advanced pack raft tracks well, is stable, and allows use of canoe or kayak paddle - ARROW SHAPE DESIGN increases maneuverability - IDEAL FOR for canyoneering and backcountry water
EASY TO INFLATE: Pump is efficient and easy to use, converts to a dry sack for gear storage and protection
TWO VALVES for QUICK INFLATION & DEFLATION, includes dry sack pump, and 6 tie-off zones for lashing gear or securing the dinghy on shore
ULTRA LIGHTWEIGHT: Weighs only 35 ounces making it one of the lightest rafts of its kind; because we are authorized sellers of this product, it includes a limited LIFETIME WARRANTY
ERGONOMIC PADDED SEATING: Built-in inflatable seat is comfortable and provides insulation from cold water

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
